intro: Leucostegia griffithiana, commonly known as the Kashmir rose or Himalayan rose, is a flowering plant native to the high altitudes of the Himalayas. It is a shrub that typically grows in rocky and alpine environments, showcasing adaptability to harsh climatic conditions. The plant produces showy, pink or white flowers that bloom in the summer months, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and often covered in a fine, silvery hair, giving it a distinctive appearance. The botanical features of Leucostegia griffithiana make it an important species in the study of alpine flora and ecological resilience.
